{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3560932,"name":"Ertu","username":"FRC_Member_apex","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/f/e480ec/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-18T19:10:57.842Z","cooked":"

This past weekend I was at an FRC competition and I saw many teams that were using button boards where if they pressed a single button it would bring their robot to the place they picked on the reef or the loading station. we have 2 limelight 4s and a pigeon 2.0. I was wondering how I could program this.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2025-03-18T19:11:33.374Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":33,"reads":176,"readers_count":175,"score":200.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":496103,"topic_slug":"apriltag-localization-with-pathplanner","display_username":"Ertu","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":74317,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/apriltag-localization-with-pathplanner/496103/1","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3560948,"name":"Matthew Flanegan","username":"TheCrackerSnacker","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/thecrackersnacker/{size}/255683_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-18T19:15:24.835Z","cooked":"

Use NetworkTables. Get buttons that can convert to USB. I’m not an electrical guy, so I don’t know exactly how to do this. But the idea is you run an app on your DriversStation that then communicates with the robot. What you handle on robot side or driverstation side is up to you. But essentially, an input coming from the driverstation is converted to a pose, then you use swerve subsystem.drive to pose

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2025-03-18T19:15:24.835Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":174,"readers_count":173,"score":49.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":496103,"topic_slug":"apriltag-localization-with-pathplanner","display_username":"Matthew Flanegan","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":74436,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"geek"},"post_url":"/t/apriltag-localization-with-pathplanner/496103/2","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3560952,"name":"Emre ","username":"DukeEmree","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/dukeemree/{size}/251833_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-18T19:18:54.220Z","cooked":"

First you need to do localization with your limelights. Your odometry is important for doing this.
Then you should have driveToPose(for full automation with avoiding obstacles you can use pathplanner) command
Then you can get field2d from Mechanical Advantage or other teams.
Then bind reef locations with your buttons.
There are lots of examples you can search other team’s code.

I dont understand how to set starting location on the paths I made on pathplanner from the data I get from localization

If you are periodically updating odometry, your camera has seen apriltag and the reset odometry button is turned off in the autonomous section in the pathplanner gui, the robot starts from where you put it.

DukeEmree:

First you need to do localization with your limelights. Your odometry is important for doing this.

DO we use megatag for localization with limelights?

I have a question. So with megatag we can find the robots position in the field and then go to apriltags that we are not currently seeing right now with the press of a single button?

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2025-03-22T18:24:16.491Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":71,"readers_count":70,"score":19.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":496103,"topic_slug":"apriltag-localization-with-pathplanner","display_username":"Ertu","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":64968,"username":"DukeEmree","name":"Emre ","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/dukeemree/{size}/251833_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":74317,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/apriltag-localization-with-pathplanner/496103/8","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3565484,"name":"Emre ","username":"DukeEmree","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/dukeemree/{size}/251833_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-22T18:31:28.864Z","cooked":"

Yes, we call this robot odometry. In other words, by localization, the robot knows its position in the field on the (x,y) coordinate plane. Using this information, you can move the robot to a certain x y value by paying attention to obstacles. The robot determines its position in the field by continuously looking at the apriltags.

What if there is like a coral or algae on its way?

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2025-03-22T20:21:50.357Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":9,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":58,"readers_count":57,"score":16.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":496103,"topic_slug":"apriltag-localization-with-pathplanner","display_username":"Ertu","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":64968,"username":"DukeEmree","name":"Emre ","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/dukeemree/{size}/251833_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":74317,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/apriltag-localization-with-pathplanner/496103/10","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3565528,"name":"Emre ","username":"DukeEmree","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/dukeemree/{size}/251833_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-22T20:30:40.211Z","cooked":"

According to my experience, they generally do not cause any problems, you can push them with the bumper and pass. What I said is valid for places that are always there, such as walls, rough areas. If you do object detection, you may be able to achieve what you want. Limelight offers ready-made models. If you are using limelight 3, you can do object detection with a co-processor like Google Coral or if you are using limelight 4, you can do object detection directly with limelight 4. Object detection is generally used for purposes such as driving on objects, picking up objects from the ground, but if you have enough opportunities, you can use it to avoid them. Still, it is probably the healthiest thing to do is for the driver to intervene.
